data.title: Multiline snippet expansion
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.8.1 (ee428b0eead68bf0fb99ab5fdc4439be227b6281, 2016-12-19T14:41:20.664Z)
- OS Version: Linux x64 4.4.36-1-MANJARO
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|Go|lukehoban|0.6.51|
|vscode-proto3|zxh404|0.0.5|

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. inside a go func block make a few lines, and press alt+down to multiselect a few blank lines
2. type in 'iferr' and press tab
3. observe that only one iferr template is expanded into the full block
![2016-12-30-131541_589x158_scrot](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1015732/21570222/168a7960-ce92-11e6-9746-32c0af413753.png)

Desired results:

In atom it will expand them all. Not expanding them all is a bug, IMO. It just gets your cursors out of sync and everything becomes a mess.

data.title: URLs with parens not recognized as full URL
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.1
- OS Version: Windows 8.1

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a new .ts file
2. Type `let url = <backtick>http://***/_api/web/lists/GetByTitle('Teambuildingaanvragen')/items<backtick>;` where the <backtick> is the symbol ` (github uses this for code, so I can't include it)

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7434048/21565581/1c9e9f18-ce9a-11e6-9f2c-5520d75e23aa.png)

This example should be ctrl+click-able and blue from the http to the items.

data.title: File compare not retaining position, when swapping between tabs
data.body:
- VSCode Version 1.8.1 :
- OS Version Win 10 Version 1607 (Build 14393.576) :

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Compare 2 files (Using "Select to Compare" - Useful if this was available in the tab - not just folder explorer).
2. Move down the comparison of the two files, change position.
3. Swap to another file within VSCode, one another tab.
4. Move back to the comparison of the two files.

Expected result: The position within the comparison is maintained.

Actual result: The user is moved to the first line of the comparision, each time they are return to the comparison view.

As I move down the comparision to look at the differences between two files, I expect the position to be maintained.

data.title: What are git-index-files
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.x ONLY
- OS Version: All

This is the second bug related to contentChanges of TextDocumentChangeEvent in VS Code 1.8. The first one is #17444 

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open a folder in VS Code
2. Create two files: a.html and b.html
3. Put focus on a.html and write any content into a.html
4. Run `git init` then `git add`
5. Switch to b.html
6. Switch to a.html

**Actual**:
The `vscode.workspace.onDidChangeTextDocument` is triggered and `event.contentChanges[0].text` returns the whole content of a.html
More seriously,`event.contentChanges[0].text` **always returns the same html string** (after tab change) before making changes using `git add a.html`
**Expect**:
`vscode.workspace.onDidChangeTextDocument` should not be triggered

As a result, this makes [my extension](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=formulahendry.auto-close-tag) not work normally:
![auto-close-tag-bug](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8117458/21478765/afdef162-cb5f-11e6-9663-66c6c803ad2e.gif)
Automatic close tag should not be added after tab switch.

data.title: Git log
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.1
- OS Version: MacOS X

VSCode has many nice git features, but one is really missing `git log`. It would be great if i could display the `git log` directly in VSCode instead of switch to the terminal or another application.

data.title: Feature Request: Collapse All for find results
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.2
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Search for something with 1 or 2 hits (e.g. A C# Reference Include) in a large project folder
2. Search results display as expected but if you only want to see the folder/files view you have to manually collapse the view of each file. With 90+ hits, this becomes tiresome.

We routinely have projects that have thousand of files and a few hundred VS solutions/projects. Searching for something like an included reference can result in a large number of hits of 1 to 3 lines.

It would be a nice feature to be able to collapse all the find results in a single click (or key shortcut) rather than selecting them individually.

data.title: New tokens format & theme matching
data.body:
Fixes #11597
Fixes #16206
Fixes #3008

TODO:

- [x] Common
  - [x] adopt new tokens representation in model & co.
  - [x] remove paranoia check in `ViewLineToken`
  - [x] remove `model.getMode()` and `model.getModeId()`
  - [x] rename `LanguageIdentifier.sid` and `LanguageIdentifier.iid`
  - [x] remove `token` class name from every token
- [x] Standalone editor
  - [x] generate new tokens format in monarch and manual tokenizers
  - [x] align standalone languages tokenizers to generate classic style tokens
  - [x] clean up standalone tokens css rules and move them to JS
  - [x] match tokens using theme rules in JS for monarch and manual tokenizers
  - [x] expose new tokenization API in standalone editor
  - [x] adopt standalone languages tests for tokenization
  - [x] validate new tokenization using tokenization.html standalone test
  - [x] allow for theme switching in `standaloneColorService`
  - [x] allow for theme customization in standalone editor
  - ~~check editor with bootstrap css~~ (created follow up task)
  - [x] add inspect tokens command
- [x] adopt new `vscode-textmate`
  - [x] publish `vscode-textmate`
  - [x] get theme information to `vscode-textmate`
  - [x] reimplement theme integration tests
  - [x] allow for theme switching
  - [x] handle encountered languages while tokenizing
  - [x] remove `dom` layer breaker from `TMSyntax.ts`
  - [x] add inspect tokens command

data.body: - VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.9.0-insider (9486bf472c5c558e4f1793e0e746da88d071b1cc, 2016-12-29T07:05:11.443Z) - OS Version: Darwin x64 16.3.0 - Extensions: |Extension|Author|Version| |---|---|---| |material-icon-theme|PKief|1.1.5| |code-settings-sync|Shan|2.4.0| |sort-lines|Tyriar|1.1.0| |html-css-class-completion|Zignd|1.0.3| |Bookmarks|alefragnani|0.10.1| |project-manager|alefragnani|0.12.2| |one-monokai|azemoh|0.2.4| |vscode-icontheme-nomo-dark|be5invis|1.2.1| |vscode-eslint|dbaeumer|1.2.2| |githistory|donjayamanne|0.1.4| |tslint|eg2|0.7.1| |vscode-great-icons|emmanuelbeziat|1.1.35| |Angular2|johnpapa|1.0.2| |theme-karyfoundation-themes|karyfoundation|10.2.0| |ftp-sync|lukasz-wronski|0.3.2| |HTMLHint|mkaufman|0.3.3| |vscode-csscomb|mrmlnc|4.0.0| |vscode-postcss-sorting|mrmlnc|2.1.0| |vscode-stylefmt|mrmlnc|2.2.0| |Theme-1337|ms-vscode|0.1.2| |angular2-inline|natewallace|0.0.16| |nonbreakingspace|smlombardi|0.0.1| |vscode-icons|robertohuertasm|4.3.0| |stylelint|shinnn|0.21.1| |darcula-extended|smlombardi|1.0.0| |theme-tesla|smlombardi|5.3.10| |bootstrap-3-snippets|wcwhitehead|0.0.9| |change-case|wmaurer|1.0.0| --- Steps to Reproduce: 1. see attached: 2. both of the items pointed out by red arrows should be scoped the same, except the ones that are purple are correctly scoped as `token meta ts decorator objectliteral object member object-literal key` but for some reason `template:` and the entire contents of `template` key are scoped as: `token meta ts decorator objectliteral object member` 3. therefore, it's impossible to correctly color the key name in a theme

data.title: Use Word Based Completion Range by Default in TS
data.body:
Fixes #17906

**bug**
To support completion items that span multiple words, I added extra logic in 1.9 insiders to use the word prefix to compute the completion range. This introduced a few regressions for completions that do start with the replacement.

**fix**
Use the old, word based range logic by default. Use the prefix completion if it is longer.

data.title: Allow to create untitled document with specific language id
data.body: Is it possible to create an untitled document using 'workbench.action.files.newUntitledFile' command for specific language id? I'm using openTextDocument passing the vscode.Uri.parse('untitled:' + filePath) which filePath has the extension I want but I have to give it a full path which is different than the Untitled documents using the newUntitledFile command.

data.title: Highlighting text in Find field can move cursor into document instead
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

I noticed that typing search terms sometimes appear in my editor instead of the "Find" window, depending on where I release the mouse button when selecting the text.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open the Find input box (ctrl-F)
2. Enter text in the Find input box
3. Click and drag to select the text, releasing the mouse button when hovering the open document tab bar
4. Selection in the Find box is cleared and cursor is placed in the document, so if you start typing, you are typing in the editor, not the find box

Screen cap:
1. Release mouse button hovering editor window: works
2. Release mouse button hovering outside of VSCode: works
3. Release mouse button hovering menu bar: works
4. **Release mouse button hovering the current document bar: loses the selection, drops cursor into document**

![vscode-find](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3969554/21555610/2da4d82e-cddf-11e6-80a0-a81226971645.gif)

data.title: Pick up TS 2.1.5 12/29 insiders
data.body: Pick up new TS 2.1.5 12/29 insider release
